title: Hurricane Ernesto moves away from Bermuda to open waters
message:
Hurricane Ernesto, which made landfall on the tiny British Atlantic territory of Bermuda early Saturday, brought heavy rains and strong winds before moving north-northeast away from the area.
Earlier, the National Hurricane Center warned of strong winds, a dangerous storm surge and significant coastal flooding.
But the hurricane warning for the area was later downgraded to a tropical storm warning.
The hurricane center reported life-threatening surf and rip currents on the East Coast of the United States and said they would reach Canada during the day.
Ernesto is the fifth named storm and the third hurricane of this year’s Atlantic hurricane season.

title: Hurricane Ernesto slams Bermuda , creates East Coast rip current risk
message:
Strong Winds, dangerous storm surge, and life-threatening flooding expected to continue on Bermuda today.
More than 18 million people are under alerts with high surf and dangerous rip currents stretching from Florida to Maine.
Officials say two men drowned at separate beaches on hilton head island in South Carolina friday due to those strong rip currents.
As seen with this hurricane, rip currents are dangerous and can be sneaky if not paid attention to.
Expect high surf and dangerous rip currents at area beaches tomorrow and Monday.

title: Hundreds of miles away , Hurricane Ernesto still affects US beaches with rip currents , house collapse
message:
In North Carolina’s Outer Banks, the National Park Service confirmed the collapse of the house Friday night in Rodanthe, one of several communities on Hatteras Island.
No injuries were reported, the park service reported.
The park service said in a statement that other homes in and near Rodanthe appeared to have sustained damage.
The park service urged visitors this weekend to avoid the Rodanthe beaches and surf, adding that dangerous debris may be on the beach and the water for several miles.
Significant debris removal wasn’t expected until early next week after the elevated sea conditions subside, the park service said.

title: Bermuda braces for direct hit from Hurricane Ernesto
message:
Bermuda braces for direct hit from Hurricane Ernestoby AFP Staff WritersMiami (AFP) Aug 16, 2024Bermuda was on high alert Friday as residents brace for Hurricane Ernesto, with heavy rain and flooding expected to wallop the island at the weekend, meteorologists and officials said.
"Ernesto is forecast to be a large hurricane near Bermuda on Saturday and maintain hurricane strength through the weekend," the NHC said in its latest advisory.
The large storm, currently a Category 2 hurricane on the five-level Saffir-Simpson scale, is set to strengthen overnight.
As the territory's emergency officials met Thursday, Minister of National Security Michael Weeks urged residents to complete their hurricane preparation as soon as possible.
